results.title: Comparison of carvedilol and atenolol for angina pectoris.
results.text_hl: Both @CHEMICAL_Carvedilol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077261 @@@carvedilol@@@, 50 mg, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, 50 mg, increased mean exercise time (24% and 34%, respectively, compared with placebo), time to @DISEASE_Angina_Pectoris @DISEASE_MESH:D000787 @@@angina@@@ (35% and 51%, respectively), and time to 1 mm of @<m>DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@ST-segment depression@@@ (54% and 102%, respectively, p less than 0.05 @CHEMICAL_Carvedilol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077261 @@@carvedilol@@@ vs @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@).

citations.NLM: Freedman SB, Jamal SM, Harris PJ, Kelly DT. Comparison of carvedilol and atenolol for angina pectoris. Am J Cardiol. 1987 Sep 1;60(7):499-502. PMID: 2888302
citations.BibTeX: @article{2888302, title={Comparison of carvedilol and atenolol for angina pectoris.}, author={Freedman SB and Jamal SM and Harris PJ and Kelly DT}, journal={Am J Cardiol}, volume={60}, number={7}, pages={499-502}}

results.title: Isosorbide-5-mononitrate and atenolol in the treatment of stable exertional angina.
results.text_hl: Fourteen @SPECIES_9606 @@@men@@@ and six @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@, 48-68 years old, with @DISEASE_Angina_Stable @DISEASE_MESH:D060050 @@@stable angina@@@ and effort-induced @<m>DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@ST-segment depression@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@ST-D@@@) were treated with @CHEMICAL_isosorbide_5_mononitrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:C030397 @@@isosorbide-5-mononitrate@@@ (@CHEMICAL_isosorbide_5_mononitrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:C030397 @@@IS-5-MN@@@) 2 x 40 mg/day and/or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@AT@@@) 100 mg/day in a double-blind randomized sequence during two 6-week periods.

citations.NLM: Waysbort J, Meshulam N, Brunner D. Isosorbide-5-mononitrate and atenolol in the treatment of stable exertional angina. Cardiology. 1991;79 Suppl 2():19-26. PMID: 1760824
citations.BibTeX: @article{1760824, title={Isosorbide-5-mononitrate and atenolol in the treatment of stable exertional angina.}, author={Waysbort J and Meshulam N and Brunner D}, journal={Cardiology}, volume={79 Suppl 2}, pages={19-26}}

results.title: Effects of atenolol and diltiazem on exercise tolerance and ambulatory ischaemia.
results.text_hl: Time to onset of 1-mm @<m>DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@ST@@@-@DISEASE_Segmentation_syndrome_1 @DISEASE_MESH:C537538 @@@segment depression@@@ was longer with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (P < 0.02) and combination therapy (P < 0.01) than with @CHEMICAL_Diltiazem @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004110 @@@diltiazem@@@.

citations.NLM: Steffensen R, Grande P, Pedersen F, Haunsø S. Effects of atenolol and diltiazem on exercise tolerance and ambulatory ischaemia. Int J Cardiol. 1993 Jul 1;40(2):143-53. PMID: 8349377
citations.BibTeX: @article{8349377, title={Effects of atenolol and diltiazem on exercise tolerance and ambulatory ischaemia.}, author={Steffensen R and Grande P and Pedersen F and Haunsø S}, journal={Int J Cardiol}, volume={40}, number={2}, pages={143-53}}

results.title: Treatment of angina pectoris with nifedipine and atenolol: efficacy and effect on cardiac function.
results.text_hl: The amount of work that could be done before @DISEASE_Angina_Pectoris @DISEASE_MESH:D000787 @@@angina@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@ST@@@ @DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@ appeared was significantly increased by @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and the combination but not by @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@.

citations.NLM: Findlay IN, MacLeod K, Ford M, Gillen G, Elliott AT, Dargie HJ. Treatment of angina pectoris with nifedipine and atenolol: efficacy and effect on cardiac function. Br Heart J. 1986 Mar;55(3):240-5. PMID: 3082344
citations.BibTeX: @article{3082344, title={Treatment of angina pectoris with nifedipine and atenolol: efficacy and effect on cardiac function.}, author={Findlay IN and MacLeod K and Ford M and Gillen G and Elliott AT and Dargie HJ}, journal={Br Heart J}, volume={55}, number={3}, pages={240-5}}

results.title: Monotherapy with amlodipine or atenolol versus their combination in stable angina pectoris.
results.text_hl: METHODS: @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Angina_Stable @DISEASE_MESH:D060050 @@@stable angina pectoris@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@ST@@@ @DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@ during exercise and ambulatory monitoring were randomized to receive @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ (n = 116) or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (n = 116), or both (n = 119).

citations.NLM: Pehrsson SK, Ringqvist I, Ekdahl S, Karlson BW, Ulvenstam G, Persson S. Monotherapy with amlodipine or atenolol versus their combination in stable angina pectoris. Clin Cardiol. 2000 Oct;23(10):763-70. PMID: 11061055
citations.BibTeX: @article{11061055, title={Monotherapy with amlodipine or atenolol versus their combination in stable angina pectoris.}, author={Pehrsson SK and Ringqvist I and Ekdahl S and Karlson BW and Ulvenstam G and Persson S}, journal={Clin Cardiol}, volume={23}, number={10}, pages={763-70}}

results.title: Medical treatment of patients with severe exertional and rest angina: double blind comparison of beta blocker, calcium antagonist, and nitrate.
results.text_hl: The duration of exercise to 1 mm @<m>DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@ST segment@@@ @DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@ was significantly greater on @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ than on @CHEMICAL_isosorbide_5_mononitrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:C030397 @@@isosorbide mononitrate@@@.

citations.NLM: Quyyumi AA, Crake T, Wright CM, Mockus LJ, Fox KM. Medical treatment of patients with severe exertional and rest angina: double blind comparison of beta blocker, calcium antagonist, and nitrate. Br Heart J. 1987 Jun;57(6):505-11. PMID: 3304367
citations.BibTeX: @article{3304367, title={Medical treatment of patients with severe exertional and rest angina: double blind comparison of beta blocker, calcium antagonist, and nitrate.}, author={Quyyumi AA and Crake T and Wright CM and Mockus LJ and Fox KM}, journal={Br Heart J}, volume={57}, number={6}, pages={505-11}}

results.title: Anti-ischaemic and anti-anginal activity of atenolol, nifedipine and their combination in stable, chronic effort angina.
results.text_hl: Also the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@-@CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@ combination significantly reduced @<m>DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@ST@@@ @DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@ at maximal common work and maximal work as compared to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@ATN@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@NIFE@@@ alone.

citations.NLM: Lai C, Onnis E, Pirisi R, Orani E, Delogu G, Cherchi A. Anti-ischaemic and anti-anginal activity of atenolol, nifedipine and their combination in stable, chronic effort angina. Drugs Exp Clin Res. 1988;14(11):699-705. PMID: 3073077
citations.BibTeX: @article{3073077, title={Anti-ischaemic and anti-anginal activity of atenolol, nifedipine and their combination in stable, chronic effort angina.}, author={Lai C and Onnis E and Pirisi R and Orani E and Delogu G and Cherchi A}, journal={Drugs Exp Clin Res}, volume={14}, number={11}, pages={699-705}}

results.title: Monotherapy with nifedipine GITS compared with atenolol in stable angina pectoris. The Working Group on Cardiovascular Research (WCN).
results.text_hl: At 4 weeks, there was no significant difference between nifedipine GITS 60 mg o.d. and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ 100 mg o.d., in respect of improved time to onset of 0.1 mV @<m>DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@ST-segment@@@ @DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@, time to onset of @DISEASE_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@pain@@@, and total exercise time.

citations.NLM: de Vries RJ, Dunselman PH. Monotherapy with nifedipine GITS compared with atenolol in stable angina pectoris. The Working Group on Cardiovascular Research (WCN). Br J Clin Pract Suppl. 1997 Apr;88():6-9. PMID: 9519501
citations.BibTeX: @article{9519501, title={Monotherapy with nifedipine GITS compared with atenolol in stable angina pectoris. The Working Group on Cardiovascular Research (WCN).}, author={de Vries RJ and Dunselman PH}, journal={Br J Clin Pract Suppl}, volume={88}, pages={6-9}}

results.title: Nifedipine gastrointestinal therapeutic system versus atenolol in stable angina pectoris. The Netherlands Working Group on Cardiovascular Research (WCN).
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ 100 mg, had a comparable effect, time to onset of 0.1 mV @<m>DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@ST@@@-segment @DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@ improved from 496 s by 53 +/- 129 s, time to onset of @DISEASE_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@pain@@@ from 572 s by 57 +/- 118 s, and total exercise time from 653 s by 33 +/- 99 s.

citations.NLM: de Vries RJ, van den Heuvel AF, Lok DJ, Claessens RJ, Bernink PJ, Pasteuning WH, Kingma JH, Dunselman PH. Nifedipine gastrointestinal therapeutic system versus atenolol in stable angina pectoris. The Netherlands Working Group on Cardiovascular Research (WCN). Int J Cardiol. 1996 Dec 6;57(2):143-50. PMID: 9013266
citations.BibTeX: @article{9013266, title={Nifedipine gastrointestinal therapeutic system versus atenolol in stable angina pectoris. results.title: Optimal control of myocardial ischaemia: the benefit of a fixed combination of atenolol and nifedipine in patients with chronic stable angina.
results.text_hl: Compared with the control the time to the start of @DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@myocardial ischaemia@@@ (1 mm @<m>DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@ST segment depression@@@) during exercise significantly increased by 3.2 (0.6) min after @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@, by 4.6 (0.4) min after @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, and by 4.6 (0.5) min after the combination; rate-pressure product (beats/min. mm Hg) at 1 mm @<m>DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@ST segment depression@@@ increased by 2824 (970) after @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@ but fell by 4436 (900) and 4501 (719) after @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and the combination.

citations.NLM: el-Tamimi H, Davies GJ. Optimal control of myocardial ischaemia: the benefit of a fixed combination of atenolol and nifedipine in patients with chronic stable angina. Br Heart J. 1992 Sep;68(3):291-5. PMID: 1389761
citations.BibTeX: @article{1389761, title={Optimal control of myocardial ischaemia: the benefit of a fixed combination of atenolol and nifedipine in patients with chronic stable angina.}, author={el-Tamimi H and Davies GJ}, journal={Br Heart J}, volume={68}, number={3}, pages={291-5}}
